name: **Carthy’s Islands**
description: Carthy’s Islands V954-280 Sheet 88 A scattered group of little islands. Only the largest, westerly island has easy, all-weather landing, onto stony beaches in cuts on the E side. These should be chosen according to tide height. These islands make a pretty group. They also make a strategically placed waystop for any tour of Roaringwater Bay, particularly one based out of Schull. Both Common and Grey Seal are present. Lesser Black-backed Gull.
